I was able to open the resource without the birt plug-ins installed.

"java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/birt/chart/device/ICallBackNotifier" This is a BIRT class failed to be loaded. Can you check if your BIRT is installed properly? Attaching screen shot for BIRT plugins installed. (also can check to see if BIRT's "Report Design" perspective can be opened properly)
Ali, can you attach your .execution file here?

After re-configuring everything on my machine, I was able to open the execution history file but the pie chart reported inconsistent percentage of passes/failed invocations when compared with the events page.

Under the events page I have 3 invocations, two of which have passed and one that has failed.  The pie chart indicates 50% pass and 50% fail.  This is likely because the overview page picks up the fail verdict of the 3rd test invocation and the fail verdict reported on the test suite.

Your overview page constructs the pie chart based on fail or passed *verdicts* instead of invocations.  It probably makes more sense to only report one of the verdicts that is reported for a test invocation (probably a failed verdict if there is at least one failed verdict associated with the invocation and a passed verdict if all verdicts associated with the test invocation are pass verdicts).  Your approach is especially a problem for automated test suites.  If multiple verification hooks fail for a test case, then multiple fail verdicts will be associated with the test case invocation, causing your pie chart to report an incorrect percentage of passed/failed test case invocations.

I have changed the title of this bug and lowered the severity to critical.
I?ve also attached my execution history file and a screen cap of the overview and events page.

Created an attachment (id=36619)
Execution history file

Ali, the pie chart is showing exactly the number of *verdicts* in your log which is what this feature is about. The two new sections "Verdict Summary" and "Verdict List" show the status of all the VerdictEvent (and VerdictEvent only) in the log, Literally.  See enhancement 103549.

That being said, the pie chart is configurable for specific test type. In your example, there is an overall VerdictEvent at the end that seems to rollup other three verdicts. Test logs are generated by test runners for specific test types so what Events are in your test logs are up to your test runners. If you want to customize the percentages shown in the pie chart, take a look at extension point "org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.executionHistoryExtension" - verdictProvider element on how to customize the pie chart. 

There are also other types of test in TPTP, if your test logs are similiar to those types, and if the same customization of pie chart is needed, it will be a good idea to provide a common extension for all of them. Ali, would you like to take the action item for that?  ;-)
I'm lowering the severity of this bug because it's working as designed (as indicated by Bianca).  I will re-target this to 4.2i3 and try to extend the pie chart so the results will be more intuitive
Exception "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No verdict for charting." is fixed. When there's no verdict in a log, it fails more gracefully now and reflects the message in UI.

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.
